TransitCenter Equity Scenario Comparison Application

Welcome to the user guide and detailed techinical documentation for the TransitCenter Equity Scenario Comparison Application (TESCA). This documentation includes a “how-to” guide for getting started running analyses, a reference on some of the design and analysis choices made and the meaning of various terms, and a code reference for developers.

If you are looking for a “how-to” guide on running a TESCA analysis, you should probably check out the user guide. If you want to get started running an analysis check out the home page.

Introduction

TESCA is a calculation tool primarily designed to compare access to opportunity measures within juristictions in the United States, and to compare the distributive equity of these access scores across multiple demographic groups.

Specifically, TESCA allows for comparison of these values based on variances in travel time matrices generated by two sets of transit schedules, times of day, days of the week, or modes of travel. For example, a comparison could be made between weekday morning and weekend morning access to opportunities by specifying these two travel times in the configuration, or between to different networks (an existing and proposed) at the same travel times.
